questions.question: Is there a yellow bow present on the head of the left teddy bear?

questions.question: Is there a turquoise ribbon tied around the neck of the right teddy bear?

questions.question: Do the paws of the left teddy bear have yellow coloring?

questions.question: Do the paws of the right teddy bear have turquoise coloring?

questions.question: Are both teddy bears equipped with black button eyes?

questions.question: Do both teddy bears have white snouts with brown noses?
questions.explanation: Analyzing Image B, both teddy bears have white snouts with brown noses. The color coordination seen in facial features is standard for teddy bear designs, providing a contrast that enhances visibility and they help in defining facial expressions.

questions.question: Are both teddy bears sitting upright with their arms resting at their sides?
questions.explanation: Both teddy bears in Image B are positioned sitting upright with arms at their sides, which can be observed directly. This pose is typical for plush toys as it is stable and visually appealing, allowing the bears to be displayed effectively. Such positioning is practical and aesthetically balanced.

questions.question: Are the two teddy bears positioned side-by-side, facing forward?
questions.explanation: The visual information in Image B shows both teddy bears positioned side-by-side, facing forward. They are arranged symmetrically, a common setup for paired toys displaying harmony and companionship. This arrangement enhances the effect of them being a pair.

questions.question: Do both teddy bears have round heads and rounded ears?
questions.explanation: In Image B, both teddy bears have round heads and rounded ears.
